Evaluating the impact of the risk is an important step that should be taken when managing a risk, but it is not the action that the PM has omitted in this scenario. In this case, the PM has identified a issue with a feature that was delivered and has submitted a change request for remediation. However, the PM has not obtained approval from the Change Control Board (CCB) for this change request. The CCB is responsible for reviewing and approving or rejecting change requests, and it is important for the PM to obtain approval from the CCB before implementing any changes to the project.

discussion.content: CompTIA Project+ Cert Guide: Exam PK0-004 "Some organizations use project coordinators when multiple projects must share resources. This type of project coordinator helps with any issues that may arise over shared resources."

A. PMO (Project Management Office) is typically responsible for ensuring resources are appropriately allocated to projects. The PMO acts as a central point of control and coordination for an organization's projects, ensuring that projects align with the organization's strategic goals and that resources are being used effectively and efficiently across projects. The PMO can also help to resolve resource conflicts between projects, ensuring that resources are being used in the most productive and cost-effective manner.

Selected Answer: A

Project Management Office
(PMO)
A PMO is an administrative unit that supervises and coordinates the
management of all projects in an organization. It focuses on
providing:
• Administrative support services, which include processes,
methodologies, policies, standards, and templates.
• Any key performance indicators and parameters that will allow
projects to measure their success.
• Training and mentoring support to project managers and project
team members.
• Support and guidance in managing projects and usage of tools.
• Support for resource allocation.
• Assistance in better communication among project managers,
sponsors, and other stakeholders.

The answer is (A) Project Management Office (PMO) they have 5 main functions:
1. Create and maintain policies and procedures
2. Embrace project management maturity
3.*** Resource Management***
4. KPIs and reporting for the projects and the enterprise at large
5. Role-based training on policies, procedures, and tools

A coordinator would only be necessary in a longer-term project, or if the organization is
designed to accommodate that particular role. There are really no set responsibilities that a
coordinator would take on, because they are there to support the project manager and
project work. Coordinators who support large projects provide administrative support by
answering emails, scheduling meetings, distributing agendas, and so on. They may also be
helping the project manager with updates to schedules and budgets and change requests.
